channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3754] Irony at its best [PIC]
[+3510] Cut Into Isosceles Triangles [PIC]
item.description: I suddenly want to try out this online ordering.

item.title: [+2227] I try to put on a happy face ... I fail. [PIC]
[+2071] Blast into Space, Spectacular Fall to Earth
item.description: Onboard cameras capture the amazing journey of Atlantis into space, and the dramatic return of the solid rocket boosters. Fast-Forward to 2:25 to get to the really cool part!

item.title: [+2025] How I discovered an Easter Egg in Donkey Kong 26 years later
item.description: In 1983, the arcade smash hit Donkey Kong was ported to the Atari 400/800 home computer systems by Landon Dyer. Mr. Dyer, in between pulling his hair out while working on this game, included what is known as an "Easter Egg" in the game's code. 26 years later, I am pleased to announce that I have discovered the way to trigger this Easter egg.

item.title: [+1946] 10 Things Gas Stations Won't Tell You
item.description: Some things could save consumers money...or prevent them from losing money unnecessarily.

item.title: [+1868] Passenger Fixes Faulty Airliner
item.description: Holidaymakers escaped a long delay to their flight home when a passenger fixed a mechanical problem with their plane.

item.title: [+1804] xkcd - A Webcomic - Cutting Edge
[+1685] Authorities Are Now Reminding Everyone To...WTF?!? (PIC)
item.description: It looks like the local authorities want everyone to be cool, man. Just, like, relax. I got this.

item.title: [+1196] Man accidentally cuts off own penis
item.description: "This was an unfortunate accident but these things happen all the time to people in his profession."

item.title: [+1137] Midgets call for U.S. to ban word 'midget'
item.description: Midgets are calling on the Federal Communications Commission to ban the use of the word 'midget' on broadcast TV.

item.title: [+1106] Stingray's leap of faith!
item.description: A stingray leaps out of the water as it is hunted by a killer whale, whose fin can be seen below the ray

item.title: [+1081] AK-47: An Assault Rifle for Everyman (Photo Gallery)
item.description: It’s probably not a stretch to describe Mikhail Kalashnikov’s AK-47 assault rifle as the most important small-arms weapon of the 20th century.

item.title: [+1048] 5 Bizarre Sexual Conditions That Can Ruin Your Life
item.description: Sometimes you hear on the news about weird medical conditions that actually cause more sex than normal. While sounding awesome these conditions are kind of like eating at Taco Bell, you may be left with internal bleeding.

item.title: [+912] A Solar Salute to America (PIC)
item.description: The solar thermal power startup eSolar tricked-out its field of mirrors to send a message to the nation for the 4th of July weekend. Translation: Happy (Energy) Independence Day U.S.A.

item.title: [+891] Every Man Please Stand UP!
[+841] New Zealand teen sells nude pictures of mum online
item.description: A NEW Zealand teenager tried to sell sexy photos of his mother in her underwear online to make some quick cash.

item.title: [+840] Bank Of America Bans Customer For Life
item.description: Jesse tried to scam Bank of America. No, wait. He tried to open two accounts at once! No, that's not right either. He did something wrong, that's obvious. Isn't it? Hello? Please tell us what Jesse did wrong, Bank of America. Your lifetime banning confuses us.

item.title: [+836] Top 10: Horniest Countries
item.description: These are the top 10 horniest countries on the planet.

item.title: [+758] Tiger Born With No Stripes
item.description: A snow white Bengal tiger has become the first of its kind to exist in the wild today after being born without stripes.
